thread.title: NFL Reportedly Denied Williams' Request to Wear Pink
thread.title_full: NFL Reportedly Denied Williams' Request to Wear Pink

author: Thomas Duffy
title: NFL Reportedly Denied Williams' Request to Wear Pink
text:
NFL Reportedly Denied Williams' Request to Wear Pink Bleacher Report 12 hrs ago Thomas Duffy © Keith Srakocic/AP Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams arrives for an NFL football game against the Baltimore Ravens, Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 in Pittsburgh. Wearing pink is only allowed in the NFL during October, Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
AdChoices Pittsburgh Steelers running back DeAngelo Williams apparently wanted to become an exception, but the NFL shut it down, per ESPN's Field Yates.
Steelers RB DeAngelo Williams wanted to wear pink all season to honor his mother who lost her battle with breast cancer. The NFL said no.
— Field Yates (@FieldYates) October 13, 2015 Williams lost his mother to breast cancer in 2014, so the veteran asked the league to let him wear pink all year as a means of honoring her. It’s a shame he won’t be able to do that.
DeAngelo Williams on breast cancer from a story last September: pic.twitter.com/zhtyXydAhd
— Bennett Hipp (@BennettHipp) October 13, 2015 Williams has gotten creative, though, and dyed his hair pink beginning last year.
This season is dedicated to u Mom. Love u and miss u. #PinkPanther pic.twitter.com/TlEw8061cG
— DeAngelo Williams (@DeAngeloRB) September 7, 2014 [Twitter, h/t SB Nation ]
